intro: Sisymbrium rusbyi, commonly known as Rusby's tansy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. This annual herb typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, yellow flowers. Its leaves are pinnately divided and have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions and is often found in desert environments.
